intro: Anil angulosa, commonly known as the angular anil, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its angular, ribbed stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Anil angulosa is often found in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical regions.
